column3: M'gizzoh is itching to go hunting.
Survey the designated location and slay any broken bhoots that appear.

<If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>Nice night<Else/>Good day</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>Good day<Else/>Nice night</If></If> for hunting isn't it? Especially now that the Garleans have turned tail and fled. Before you couldn't step foot from the Peering Stones without being dragged into a fight between them and the Resistance.
Now that we're back to our usual haunts, I've run into a bit of trouble. It seems in our absence a horde of bhoots have taken a liking to my favorite place to hunt.
They're always hiding on the cliff tops just out of range of my arrows, and swooping down when I'm not looking. Would that I had wings to fly up after them.
Word has it you have a knack for handling seemingly insurmountable problems. It'd mean the world to me if you could scale the cliffs southwest of here and do away with the bhoots.
You may not see them at first, but if you wait around long enough, they're sure to turn up. Be careful, though. They can be pretty nasty.
The bhoots are gone? So you did scale the cliffs! That's quite the feat.
A pity you're not part of our tribe. We could do with more capable hunters like you.
But what are ghosts doing there to begin with? By all rights they should be busy brooding about a cemetery somewhere.
Then again, Virdjala has seen more than its fair share of death lately. Hopefully any other spirits still lingering there will soon move on.
